description:
Streptomyces ambofaciens is a species of actinobacteria belonging to the genus Streptomyces. It is a Gram-positive, aerobic, and filamentous bacterium commonly found in soil environments.

Streptomyces ambofaciens is known for its ability to produce a variety of secondary metabolites, including the antibiotics spiramycin and streptonigrin. These compounds have been extensively studied for their pharmaceutical and agricultural applications.

The genome of Streptomyces ambofaciens is relatively large, typically ranging between 8 to 10 million base pairs, and is known to contain a high proportion of guanine and cytosine (G+C) nucleotides, which is a characteristic feature of the Streptomyces genus.

This species is widely used in biotechnology and industrial microbiology due to its versatile metabolic capabilities and potential for the production of valuable natural products. Ongoing research continues to explore the genetic and biochemical mechanisms underlying the diverse secondary metabolite biosynthesis pathways in Streptomyces ambofaciens.
